titleStmt.title: C. W. Milliken et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG11173

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
Franklin Ky March 10th 1862
To hHis Excelency B Magoffin, Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

The undersigned, Your petitioners would respectfully represent to your Excelency that at the March Term 1861 of the Simpson Equity & Criminal Court one John Alexander of Franklin a grocer, was Indcted for Selling Spirituous liquors to the Slave of another without permissiones & also for permitting Slaves to Congregate about his Grocery house & at the September Term of said Court Said Alexander was tried & found guilty, & fined in each case the sum of $20.00 We would respectfully represent that the Said fines are yet unpaid. & That Alexander is a man of limited means, having the greater portion of his effects in a family grocery, & That he has been Sick almost the entire winter being unable to attend to business & during which time the Soldiers have broken into his said Grocery taking therefrom Several hundred dollars worth of goods. We therefore represent him as an individual worthy your Executive Clemancy & pray that you may remit said fines, We will ever pray

J J LaRue
R. F. Milliken
C. W. Milliken
S Mercer
R L Louthat
A G Jones
E H. Hendrick
J. P. Hutchings
Samuel Butler
T H Butler
N. B. Suddarth
T. C. Murphy
Alexander farmer
G. P. Tidwell
T. J.Whitesells
O W. Grade Sheriff
J, C Bell
Wm W, Bush
A Karr
W G Hudson
Volney S,, Bissreau
A. B. Cooksey,
J, B, McClean
Enoch Powell
Theo. Robey
R, M, Green
N B, Tannehill
John B Mayes
J W Robey
C. L. Clarke (B L. Clarke brother of)

$20 2 cases } Liquor
Jno. Alexander
Respd 12 mo.
Issd Apr. 24. 1862
